DOC.brief_summary: The SUCCESS Trial is designed to determine whether the Solace Bladder Control System is safe and effective for the treatment of Stress Urinary Incontinence (SUI) in adult females.
DOC.brief_title: Solace Stress Urinary inContinence Control Efficacy and Safety Study
DOC.detailed_description: Subject will undergo treatment with the Solace Bladder Control System or a sham procedure, with the results being compared at 3 months. All patients undergoing sham treatment are treated at 3 months.
DOC.criteria: Female 18 years of age or older with stress urinary incontinence (SUI) Experienced SUI for at least 12 months and attempted and failed prior noninvasive treatment Willing to undergo cystoscopic procedures required and 36 month followup On stable medication for a minimum of 3 months Free of local genital skin infection Positive Pad Weight Test Free of impassable urethral strictures, trauma or necrosis Pregnant or planning to become pregnant during the study period Nonambulatory or bedridden or physically unable to complete test exercises Morbidly obese (defined as BMI â‰¥ 40 kg/m2) Incontinence of neurogenic etiology Urge predominant Mixed Incontinence Bladder infection (including bladder inflammation or edema) or Urinary Tract Infection (UTI) within 3 months History of recurrent urinary tract infections Prior surgical procedure for incontinence within the past 6 months Is taking medications for urinary incontinence other than anticholinergics History of recurrent (>1) or recent (within 5 years) kidney stone(s) Has a prosthetic heart valve Unable to tolerate any form of antibiotic Taking anticoagulation therapy, other than aspirin Has urinary incontinence due to Intrinsic Sphincter Deficiency (ISD)
